newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares dip as Ericsson falls after result.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares dip as Ericsson falls after result.

text.p: Swedish share prices closed marginally down on Tuesday following a bumpy session as the market reacted after telecommunications group Ericsson's 1996 results.
Ericsson closed down four crowns at 248 after posting a 33 percent jump in pre-tax profits for 1996. The share had fallen 2.5 crowns ahead of the result and was seen remaining volatile.

"People were long in the share before the report so there is no real upside," one Stockholm trader said. "But there was nothing negative in the report and the share price could swing several times later today."
The result was a touch higher than market expectations.
Drug group Astra counterbalanced some of the fall by fellow blue-chip Ericsson and closed 2.5 crowns higher at 357.5, shrugging off a drug sector fall in New York overnight.
The forestry sector index rose 1.16 percent, outshining other sectors.
One dealer said the session demonstrated the market's underlying strength.
"This shows just how strong the market really is -- despite a fall in New York last night and in Ericsson, the market is resisting well," one chief dealer said.
